data.html:
In Java, the int data type is a 32-bit signed integer. It is commonly used when you need a whole number that fits within the range of -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647. This range is because an int uses 4 bytes (32 bits), where one bit is used for the sign (positive or negative), and the rest represent the actual number.
Below code demonstrates different integer data types in Java: byte, short, int, and long

byte can store values between -128 and 127.
It is used when memory optimization is needed (e.g., for storing small values).

short can store values between -32,768 and 32,767.
Used when dealing with larger numbers than byte but still needing memory efficiency.

The most commonly used integer type in Java.
Can store a wider range of numbers.

Used when values exceed the int limit.
Used when values exceed the int limit.
